street.description: Include your civic number and street name, apartment or suite, and other address details.
street.label: Street address

attestation.description: Use a legal attestation block when form fillers must attest to certain conditions to continue. This block allows you to add one or several required checkboxes.
attestation.title: Legal attestation

email.description: Enter your email address. For example: name@example.com
email.label: Email address

language.description: We offer our services in both official languages, French and English
language.label: What is your preferred language for communication?

phone.description: Enter your phone number. For example: 111-222-3333
phone.label: Phone number

dynamicRow.description: The repeating question block provides form fillers with the option to add a set of similar answers to the section. This block works with one question or a group of related questions.
dynamicRow.title: Repeating set

name.description: Include your first and last names. Middle names are optional
name.label: Full name
name.title: What is your name?

richText.description: Text for paragraphs, hyperlinks, and lists.
richText.title: Large text

autocompleteOptions.address-line1: Address line 1 (civic number and street name)
autocompleteOptions.name: Full name (includes first, middle and last names)

autocompleteWhenNotToUse.text1: Auto complete attributes may not work well for information the form filler does not enter regularly. Things like historical or business information may not fill in correctly.
autocompleteWhenNotToUse.text2: Usability testing is a good way to understand if the rules you set cause problems with filling in forms.
autocompleteWhenNotToUse.title: When not to use autocomplete

branding.heading: Branding
branding.notFound: Didn’t find your department or agency on the list?
branding.select: Select a different branding option for the top of your form
branding.submitNew: Submit a new branding option (opens in new tab)
branding.text1: GC Forms displays the Government of Canada signature at the top of your form by default.

characterLimitDescription: Only use a character limit when there is a good reason for limiting the number of characters users can enter.

characterLimitWhenToUse.text1: Evidence that users are likely to enter more information than they need to.
characterLimitWhenToUse.text2: A legal or technical reason that means an entry must be no more than a certain number of characters.
characterLimitWhenToUse.text3: If your users keep hitting the character limit imposed by the backend of your service then try to increase the limit rather than use a character count.
characterLimitWhenToUse.title: Reasons for using a character limit

confirmationDescriptionItem1: details of what happens next and when.
confirmationDescriptionItem3: links to information or services that users are likely to need next.
confirmationDescriptionItem4: a link to your feedback form. (if you don’t have one, you can set one up using GC Forms to be launched along with your main form).
confirmationDescriptionParagraph: The confirmation message will appear on a new page once the form has been submitted. Some useful things you can add to your confirmation page are:
contactSupportIfYouHaveQuestions: Contact support if you have any questions.

contactus.name: Name

contactus.ifYouExperience: To get technical support, use the

contactus.useThisForm: Use this form to learn more about GC Forms and how it can work in your government department or agency.

defaultElementDescription.email: Enter an email address. For example: name@example.com
defaultElementDescription.phone: Enter a phone number. For example: 111-222-3333

descriptionDescription: The description appears below the label and before the field. It’s used to add context and instructions for the field. It’s a great place to specify formatting requirements.
didYouFindThisToolHelpful: Did you find GC Forms helpful? Provide feedback

card.noResponsesToDownload: There are no responses available to download.

download.atLeastOneFile: At least one file must be selected to download.
download.trySelectingLessFiles: Max of {{max}} files can be downloaded at once. Please try selecting fewer files.

downloadResponsesTable.skipLink: Skip the responses for download table

errorSaving: There was an error saving the form. Try again or contact support.

formDeleteResponses.title: Confirm responses before deleting form
formDeleteResponses.message1: This form has been published and is receiving responses. You have responses to download and confirm.
formDeleteResponses.message4: 2. Confirm the receipt of downloaded responses

draft.message1: Deleting a form cannot be undone. Your form will be removed from your forms list.
draft.message2: Download a copy of this form for your records. The saved JSON form file can be uploaded again to create a new form later.

published.message1: Deleting a form cannot be undone. Your form will be removed from your forms list and the Internet.
published.message2: Download a copy of this form for your records. The saved JSON form file can be uploaded again to create a new form later.
published.message3: The URL of your form will change if you upload your form again.

formDeletedResponsesExist: The form could not be deleted. Ensure there are no new responses and try again.

formDownload.btnText: What can I do with a form file?
formDownload.description: Keep a version of your form on your computer

dialog.message1: Download a form file to share a draft form with others. Collaborators can upload the form file and view the progress that has been made.
dialog.message2: Download a copy of the your form to store locally on your computer.
dialog.title: Form file uses

formDownload.title: Download form file

formSubmissionDisabledInPreview: Form submission is disabled in preview
ifYouAreExperiencingProblems: If you are experiencing any problems with your published form, please contact support.

maxNumberOfRows.description: Users can provide up to this many entries for this question.
maxNumberOfRows.label: Maximum number of answers

previewDisabledForPublishedForm: Preview is disabled for published forms
privacyNoticeDescription:
Help people filling out the form understand how you’re handling their personal information, as outlined in Section 4.2.10 of the Directive on privacy practices.

What to include in a privacy notice

  • What personal information is being collected and why.
  • What legal or program authorities you have to collect information.
  • How their information will be used, shared, stored, and retained.
  • How people can access or change their personal information and file complaints.

You’re responsible for understanding your department or agency's responsibilities related to personal information. If you’re unsure how to proceed, we recommend contacting your access to information and privacy coordinator.
publishedViewLinks: View and share your published form with these links:
publishingDisablesEditingDescription: Once you publish, you cannot make changes to this form. If changes are needed after publishing, use the form file to create and publish a new form.
publishingLocksSettingsDescription: The response delivery option you choose will no longer be changeable.
publishingRemovesTestResponsesDescriptio: Any prior responses will be removed from the system.

responseDeliveryHelp.title: Choosing a response delivery option
responseDeliveryHelp.description: There are two options for getting submitted form responses. Use the chart below to help pick which option best fits your needs.

inbox.text1: For up to PROTECTED A forms
inbox.text2: Responses are delivered directly to an inbox in real time
inbox.text3: One email address can receive response emails. This can be a shared inbox.

share.stepTwoDetails: Go to GC Forms. No account needed.
share.stepTwoDetailsNoHTML: Go to GC Forms (https://forms-formulaires.alpha.canada.ca/). No account needed.
share.title: Share

unauthenticated.description: You cannot share a form directly from GC Forms without an account. Sign in or create an account to get access to this feature and more.
unauthenticated.instructions: You can download a copy of this form file to your computer and share it through your email.
unauthenticated.step1Details: Download a copy of your form as a JSON form file to your computer
unauthenticated.step2Details: Copy and paste the email instructions into an email and attach the form file

nagware.restrictedDownloadAfter35Days: Downloading will be restricted if unconfirmed responses are older than 35 days.

unsavedSubmissionsOver21DaysOld.title: Download and confirm receipt of responses

body2.moreThan20Responses: new responses older than 21 days. Download and confirm receipt of 20 overdue new responses at a time.
body2.lessThan20Responses: new responses older than 21 days. Download and confirm receipt of all overdue new responses.

unconfirmedSubmissionsOver21DaysOld.title: Confirm receipt of responses
unconfirmedSubmissionsOver21DaysOld.body2: unconfirmed responses older than 21 days. Confirm receipt of all overdue unconfirmed responses.

unsavedSubmissionsOver35DaysOld.title: Downloading is restricted to overdue responses until they are downloaded and confirmed

body2.moreThan20Responses: new responses over 35 days old. Download and confirm 20 overdue responses at a time before continuing.
body2.lessThan20Responses: new responses over 35 days old. Download and confirm all overdue responses before continuing.

unconfirmedSubmissionsOver35DaysOld.title: Downloading is restricted until receipt of responses is confirmed
unconfirmedSubmissionsOver35DaysOld.body2: unconfirmed responses 35 days overdue. Confirm the receipt of all overdue downloaded responses before saving new ones.

vaultNote.text2: Email delivery is not available for this data classification
